newsitem.title: UK: S&N rises as analysts boost forecasts.
newsitem.headline: S&N rises as analysts boost forecasts.

text.p: Shares in Scottish & Newcastle were up 12-1/2p to 651-1/2p by 1257 GMT on Monday as several analysts, impressed with the UK brewer's 26 percent rise in interim profits, boosted their earnings forecasts, dealers said.
UBS said it upgraded the stock to "buy" from "hold," and raised its earning estimates by 18 million stg for 1996 and by 25 million stg for 1997.
SocGen reiterated its "buy" stance, and said it may bump its profit forecast up slightly.
SBC Warburg also repeated its "buy" recommendation and boosted its 1996 profit forecast slightly.
Goldman Sachs, which has had an "outperform" rating on Scottish & Newcastle, said it also was considering making a small upward adjustment on its profit outlook.
Earlier, the company reported half-year pre-tax profits of 195.1 million stg, beating analysts' best estimates and year-ago earnings of 158.2 million stg.
The brewer also raised its dividend to a higher-than-expected 7.1p per share from 6.55p per share previously.
